These include purchasing large quantities of stock, spreading false or manipulated information, buying stock on margin and selling when the price rises, creating or using fake account and news to manipulate prices and influencing investors through social media campaigns. You should also consider engaging in short-selling which involves selling shares that you don't currently own but borrowed from another investor, with the intention of buying them back at a lower price and pocketing the difference.
